storyInfo: A Reunion camp is attacked by Victorian soldiers while Reunion gathers the Infected near Londinium. Guard recognizes that the soldiers are already infected.

attributes.text: It's hot.
\nThe sun is burning. I'm burning.
Is that the exit?
\nA few steps further.
\nJust put one foot in front of the other. Maybe the fire, the anger, the pain, and the regret are all just figments of my imagination.
\nOr maybe the exit is. I don't know.
But they're watching behind me. Those eyes... are they judging me? Or just waiting to see how I'll carry the burden of their deaths?
\nThey were great men, with tremendous accomplishments.
My commander, and the legendary Sarkaz scout... and the Captain, the last pure-blood Wendigo.
\nThey're all dead, before me, behind me.
\nAll that's left is sad little me, worthless me. They died so I could live.
\nWhat did they expect of me?
I can't think about it... I can't.
\nI can't let their deaths be meaningless.
I have to face the sun, even if it burns me.
\nBurn me to cinders, so that in their mighty company, I shall not be ashamed.

attributes.content: Ugh...
You really do have a knack for waking up right at shift change, don't you?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Is this the result of all that hard training, Guard?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: ...Percival.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I stretch, as much as I'm allowed to. I did not sleep particularly well. On top of that series of nightmares, the old wound in my leg aches.
\nWe almost ran straight into the Victorian battle lines in order to catch up with Nine.
The Infected I'm in charge of are used to being spat on, used to not having hope, but they've never been on a real battlefield.
\nThey were scared headless. I was one of the better ones... and I hate that I'm used to it.
\nIt took a lifetime's worth of good luck for us to make it to the camp in one piece.

attributes.content: Just too hot, even at night.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: How long until the shift change?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Fifteen minutes. You can sit a while longer.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I'll go wash my face.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: What's with your leg? You're limping.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: ...Have the crystals spread?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: No. Not yet.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Give me my towel, Percival. It's to your left.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The floral pattern?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: Percival raises an eyebrow. I want to say it was a gift from the owner of that County Peninsula textile factory. Red has one just like it.
\nThe old man had creases all over his face. He was lucky that his crystals grew on his belly, so all he needs to do is wear a shirt. Hopefully, he's still hiding them.

attributes.content: Never mind.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: You brought back more hands than expected. Looks like the situation in the provinces is deteriorating, even before they turn into war zones.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The impact is bigger than I thought, the nobles are turning a blind eye. Pretty much as expected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Those towns made a living trading with the caravans. They're left hanging with the convoys to Londinium stopped on account of the war.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The Infected are always the first to get hit when things go south. They used to be able to plant a few crops on the edge of town, and villagers were willing to trade with them here and there. Money is money, after all, whoever it's from.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It's easy to do the respectable thing when life is decent.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Things are different now.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: It's almost time for the bean harvest. These Infected spent the last season watering the fields, caring for their crops.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But they've chosen to run off and join us now, abandoning the harvest that would have been waiting for them in a few months, and those to come in the future. They would rather leave.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: They must be desperate.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We Infected may be used to this kind of 'deprivation'.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But we can't come to the same conclusion every time.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Are you still resting, sir?
I hear voices. You're awake.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: You again. I said—
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Are you taking the night shift now?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Supper? I have canned food from Victoria. Not the best in terms of taste, but convenient.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Cigarettes, wine, a bit of a pick-me-up in the middle of the night? Pretty clean, all things considered. Razors, Arts Units, you name it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: What about you, Percival? Would you like some hair cream? Not easy to find this stuff these days. It's usually only the officers who carry it, after all.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Officers don't die so often?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: No, just harder to dig them out from the heap. They're usually at the bottom, you know.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: You need medicine again?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Well, I haven't been feeling my best... a lot of pain, the occasional hallucination... I'm scared that the rocks could start growing into my brain.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: It's not going to get any better if you keep digging in those dusty craters.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The best we can do is basic medicine that slows the progression of the condition. Don't expect it to save your life.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I know, I know, I—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: I know you're re-selling our medicine.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: This bunch of Infected told me that they bought Oripathy meds from a Sarkaz on a motorbike, and that they 'worked okay'.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Well, but—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Made some decent money, didn't you? How about we decide your punishment based on how many coins you have in your pocket?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I was just, er, making sure that stuff got where it's needed... there's a war going on, after all.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: You won't get another warning.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But at least the meds made it to them, when we don't have enough Messengers to deliver to everyone.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It won't happen again, I promise! Just a little bit... a few pills! I've been running a fever for days.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Guard?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Put in a form for him. Make sure he's registered this time.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Th-Thank you!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Don't thank us. Thank the doctors.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: They went from elite to pariah when they contracted Oripathy in their labs and their companies didn't want to pay the insurance. It's not an easy change to accept.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Fortunately, they heard of the Reunion and came looking for us.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: What about your old stomping grounds?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I'm more than just grateful to them, but they'll never forgive me... I chose this path on my own.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We just don't have the same grade of equipment that Rhodes Island does. Well, we're not really developing medicine either.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Right... we don't take medicine to get well, just to live a little longer.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: There is no medicine that will cure Oripathy.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I still remember the operators hurrying around Medical, and the sight of Dr. Kal'tsit in her lab when I was at Rhodes Island.
\nIf there is hope for an Oripathy cure, then it's at Rhodes Island.
\nI still feel a sense of pride for having been part of it... even though I have no right to, because I chose betrayal.
But when will the day come when a cure for Oripathy is found?
\nFifty years? A hundred years? A thousand years? And what do the Infected do before then?
\nOripathy is no longer just a condition.
It is a symbol of hatred, victimization, blame, and alienation.
\nEveryone here has a story, and they are all alike.
\nWhat good is medicine in the face of all that?
\nIt is like rowing against the tide. This land is not a glorious one of morality and kindness.
That's why we can't turn away from violence, shameful as it is, it's powerful.
\nBut, maybe... no, that's something for the distant future.

attributes.content: What's your name?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Me? Oh...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Erm... 'Medicine Peddler'? 'Man On Bike'? I'm not the kind of guy anyone needs to remember.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: That's not a name.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Ok, let me think of a cool one—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.content: Wh-What's going on?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Drifter

attributes.text: Shouting, and the sound of weapons clanging.

attributes.content: Go hide in the back, Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Percival, go and reassure the civilians that just joined us. They're scared enough as is.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I put a hand on the sword on my belt. It is always at the ready.

attributes.content: Hrrh— hrrh—
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: You really want me to kill you? You men are in no shape to fight.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.text: Our warriors surround a group of bruised and dirty Victorian soldiers. Their sergeant is panting, with fresh wounds on his body.
\nWas this really an attack?

attributes.content: What's going on, Nine?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: They sneaked into the village from the north. Romanich took a bolt. The doctor is taking care of him now.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: They're out of their minds, trying to attack our camp with just twenty-one men, including a handful on stretchers.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Ha! Look at what we have in the heartland of our country, a stone's throw from our great capital!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: A swarm of damned Reunion Infected! Come! Kill me if you dare! Or I'll kill you all!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Conspirators, agitators, rioters, murderers... a blight! You're a blight!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: No wonder the war is going badly! Those barbaric devils could never beat us! The real enemy is among us, behind our backs!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Wherever there's disorder, you Infected are never far away!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Looks like you just came back from the front lines.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Low morale, poor organization, hastily wrapped wounds, obsolete equipment... you don't look like professional soldiers. Conscripts?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We're from the Duke of Fife's Fourth Battalion... what's the name of the company again? Blackstream Squad and Eastham Squad. Do you have a doctor here?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Shut up, soldier, and ready your weapon!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: But Sergeant, Victor...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: This is an order! Ready your weapon!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Keep your voice down, Victorian. There are civilians sleeping in the camp.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Victorian civilians.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Civilians? Victoria would have given them the life they deserve, if they didn't join you to become criminals and malcontents!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Why are all the scum in this land Infected?
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Why is every gangster, bandit, devil, and Reunion traitor an Infected?
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Why is the honorable Duke of Fife not Infected? Why was His Majesty Frederick III not Infected? Why are honest and upright folk not Infected?
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Do people become despicable because they're Infected... or do they become Infected because they're despicable?
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Is despicability infectious too?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: How dare you—
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Enough!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.text: The Victorian sergeant's eyes widen as he turns to one side, trying to hide his arm from my sight.
\nHis lips tremble, but no words come out.

attributes.content: We're all despicable scum now!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: ...Aren't we, sir?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I'm different... this is an honorable...
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Your arm.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I can see the crystals protruding from it. Your condition is progressing rapidly.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'm fighting and killing Sarkaz for my country! I just got a bit of dirt on it... maybe devil blood...
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: What did you learn in boot camp? Didn't they teach you anything about Active Originium Zones?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The instructor just told us to aim and pull the trigger... that's what we spent our two weeks on.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I take it you weren't issued any inhibitors, either.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Er... inhibitors?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Nine, I think they're all Infected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I-It can't be! I just got a physical one week ago, and I was in perfect health!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: One week... could be a rapid onset. Or they lied to you to keep you on the front lines.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: How long have the ones on the stretchers been unconscious? They're in critical condition.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Death and disintegration from acute condition is dangerous to both you and us.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You were right to have the unconscious lying face-up on the stretchers, to prevent suffocation.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But... did you check their backs?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.text: Suddenly silent, the sergeant walks towards the stretcher, as though trying to turn the man lying on it over, but withdraws his hand as soon as it touches the soldier.
\nThe sergeant looks helpless, like he's facing a deadly tuskbeast that could spit lightning and poison, one that could leap at him at any moment.
\nBut the man is his comrade. Before they were comrades, they might have been cousins, tilling the same piece of land together.
I sigh and sit the unconscious Victorian soldier up.
\nThere is no need to remove his jacket. Originium crystals have pierced the clothing on his back.

attributes.content: Heavens...
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Victor! Damn it!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I shouldn't have taken him along... his dad would kill him, then kill me, if he learned that his son was Infected!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Those Sarkaz used witchcraft to infect us! I knew it! It's the devil's curse!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: It's not enough that they defiled our land, now they want to defile our souls too!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: That's enough.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Sarkaz are naturally susceptible to Infection, and their soldiers are overwhelmingly Infected. When you kill them, or when you get Infected and they kill you...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: If there's no one to clean up the bodies...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I said no more. I heard a sound.
\nIt's a familiar sound, whether in Rim Billiton, Rhodes Island, or here and now.
\nThe sound that every Infected fears most.
\nThe sound of us shattering.

attributes.content: I've heard... sounds... in the trenches...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: You told me it was artillery, Sergeant!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It was artillery!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Our enemy will use anything and everything to destroy us and our country, including their own deaths!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: Devils, bandits, Tarans... there was none of this crap during His Majesty Frederick III's reign!
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: We... we must expel this scum from Victoria... we...
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: We...
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: What can we do? Can we save Victor? We... we dwell in the blessing of glorious Victoria...
attributes.name: Angry NCO

attributes.content: What an idiot.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'll say this again. You're an Infected. Very Infected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: In case this isn't clear to you, like us, like everyone else here...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: You're going to die.
attributes.name: Guard
